Subnet resource Id for the AKS image builder subnet
Subnet resource Id for the AKS jumpbox subnet

The hub's regional affinity. All resources tied to this hub will also be homed in this region.  The network team maintains this approved regional list which is a subset of zones with Availability Zone support.
A /24 to contain the regional firewall, management, and gateway subnet

resources.comments: This Log Analytics workspace stores logs from the regional hub network, its spokes, and bastion.

resources.name: [variables('bastionNetworkNsgName')]
resources.comments: Wraps the AzureBastion subnet in this regional hub. Source: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/bastion/bastion-nsg

resources.name: [variables('hubVnetName')]
resources.comments: This is this region's hub network.

resources.name: [variables('hubFwPipNames')[copyIndex()]]
resources.comments: This is a public IP for this regional hub's firewall. You'll want as many as necessary to avoid SNAT port exhaustion. Typical production hubs may require 20 IPs -- we only deploy three here as a reference.

resources.name: [variables('bastionPipName')]
resources.comments: This is the public IP for this regional hub's Azure Bastion service.

resources.name: [variables('bastionServiceName')]
resources.comments: This is this regional hub's Azure Bastion service.

resources.name: [variables('aksIpGroupName')]
resources.comments: This holds IP addresses of known nodepool subnets in attached spokes.

resources.name: [variables('imageBuilderIpGroupName')]
resources.comments: This holds IP addresses of known AKS Jumpbox image building subnets in attached spokes.

resources.name: [variables('aksJumpBoxIpGroupName')]
resources.comments: This holds IP addresses of known AKS Jumpboxs in attached spokes.

resources.name: [variables('hubFwName')]
resources.comments: This is the regional Azure Firewall that all regional spoke networks can egress through.

rules.name: ntp
rules.description: Network Time Protocol (NTP) time synchronization for image builder VMs, nodepool nodes, and jumpboxes.

rules.name: runtime
rules.description: This covers all runtime requirements for AKS (sans addons). If you wish to use a more restricted set of values than what this provides, see: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/firewall/protect-azure-kubernetes-service and https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/aks/limit-egress-traffic#required-outbound-network-rules-and-fqdns-for-aks-clusters and remove this entry

rules.name: azure-monitor-addon
rules.description: All required for Azure Monitor for containers per https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/aks/limit-egress-traffic#azure-monitor-for-containers - Optionally you can restrict the ods and oms wildcards to JUST your clusters' log analytics instances.

rules.name: azure-policy-addon
rules.description: All required for Azure Policy per https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/aks/limit-egress-traffic#azure-policy. If not using the AzureKubernetesService fqdnTag, you must also add gov-prod-policy-data.trafficmanager.net, raw.githubusercontent.com, and dc.services.visualstudio.com

rules.name: flux-to-github
rules.description: This address is required for Flux <-> Github repository with the desired cluster baseline configuration.

rules.name: to-azuremanagement
rules.description: This for AIB VMs to communicate with Azure management API.

rules.name: to-blobstorage
rules.description: This is required as the Proxy VM and Packer VM both read and write from transient storage accounts (no ability to know what storage accounts before the process starts.)

rules.name: apt-get
rules.description: This is required as the Packer VM performs a package upgrade. [Step performed in the referenced jump box building process. Not needed if your jump box building process doesn't do this.]

rules.name: install-azcli
rules.description: This is required as the Packer VM needs to install Azure CLI. [Step performed in the referenced jump box building process. Not needed if your jump box building process doesn't do this.]

rules.name: install-k8scli
rules.description: This is required as the Packer VM needs to install k8s cli tooling. [Step performed in the referenced jump box building process. Not needed if your jump box building process doesn't do this.]

rules.name: install-helm
rules.description: This is required as the Packer VM needs to install helm cli. [Step performed in the referenced jump box building process. Not needed if your jump box building process doesn't do this.]

rules.name: install-flux
rules.description: This is required as the Packer VMs needs to install flux cli. [Step performed in the referenced jump box building process. Not needed if your jump box building process doesn't do this.]

rules.name: install-open-service-mesh
rules.description: This is required as the Packer VMs needs to install open service mesh cli. [Step performed in the referenced jump box building process. Not needed if your jump box building process doesn't do this.]

rules.name: install-terraform
rules.description: This is required as the Packer VMs needs to install HashiCorp Terraform cli. [Step performed in the referenced jump box building process. Not needed if your jump box building process doesn't do this.]

rules.name: az-login
rules.description: Allow jumpboxes to perform az login.

rules.name: az-management-api
rules.description: Allow jumpboxes to communicate with Azure management APIs.

rules.name: az-cli-extensions
rules.description: Allow jumpboxes query az cli status and download extensions

rules.name: github
rules.description: Allow pulling things down from GitHub. [Only a requirement of this walkthrough because we deploy some manifests that you clone from your repo.]

rules.name: azure-monitor-addon
rules.description: Required for Azure Monitor Extension on Jumpbox.
